values: By constant elimination The manifest universe Yielded an armour Against utter consternation, A Minoan undulation, Seen, we admit, amid ambrosial circumstances Strengthened him against The discouraging doctrine of chances, And his desire for survival, Faint in the most strenuous moods, Became an Olympian apathein In the presence of selected perceptions.

So after I worked out today I was leaving the IMA and walking by the tennis courts when I noticed the girls tennis team was practicing.  So I stopped for a minute to leer, I mean watch.  Anyway before I knew it I looked at the clock and I had been sitting there for about 40 minutes.  Yep, I'm definately not a creep.

So far things are looking up this quarter.  I'm actually going to class, things from last quarter are straightening up fairly well and every day gets me a day closer to going to Stockholm for a year and leaving all you losers behind.  Yes!

Other exciting excitement: Tyson and Travis motherfuckin' Williams came for a little visit last weekend which was a hoot as always.  Except the next time Travis slow plays a boat and lets me catch the nut straight on the river I may just have to break his legs.  And today Reed scored us free Mariners tickets and we got to watch a pretty awesome game, even though I missed most of the 7th inning because this totally hot pear-shaped mom was shaking her badonkadonk (yes I said it) like a British Nanny shakes a baby the entire time.  I also saw, and heard, someone take a foul ball straight off the top of their melon from about 200 feet away which made me glad I wasn't them.  In conclusion, it doesn't get much better than 20th row behind the dugout, filthy moustachioed peanut vendors and 8 dollar beers.

Would you rather play footsie with Osama bin Laden or the pope?

Hearts live by being wounded.


So after 5 hours today, and many more to come tomorrow of grading inane complicated time-consuming computer science solutions, I've decided that grading finals is much much worse than taking them.  However I have a pretty exciting break to look forward to: a twenty-first birthday on friday (I'll expect your presents in the mail), a beach trip, and a swinging bachelors' trip to vegas.  Should be fun.

I hope this will break me out of my lugubrious state.
I hereby admit defeat.  I give up.

So for those of you keeping score at home, I'm pretty sure that I'm going to hell.  Apparently yesterday, amidst a night of general bedlam, I stole some random girl's cell phone.  Now my recount may be a bit dubitable for certain reasons which can be imbibed, but I guess I just found a phone that was the same model as mine, switched the SIM cards and left her with a phone that has a substantial crack on the outer screen.  Yet, for some reason, I kept my completely drained battery and left her her fully charged battery, because apparently my thought process was: "leaving someone with a dead battery after stealing their phone is just rude".  However, since this whole situation would have been avoided if the person who broke my phone (Jason) had replaced it, I am going to put 80% of the blame on him.  And, if you ask me, she got the better end of the deal because she now has all my sweet pictures and ring tones.  I am curious though as to how long it will take her to realize that the cracked phone with a picture of a two-pound hamburger on the backdrop and a 'Don't Fear the Reaper' ring is hers.

Other memorable memories: This weekend Scott hooked up with a somewhat classy broad. Anything to be said about that can be summed up by my favorite quote from the whole weekend:

Travis Williams: "Bryson, Scott made out with Jonel last night!"
Bryson: "... why?"


I must say though I was definately charmed with all Ellensburg had to offer.  From the single smoke shop where a meth head who had just parked his truck in the middle of the driveway into the parking lot accosted Travis and kept telling him his name meant "meet me at the crossroads", to Ellensburg's own illustrious Cleopatra's Wild Goose Casino where I lost 80 bucks and Travis took third in a blackjack tournament like a badass.

Also, I'm fairly certain Lauren Short will never speak to any of us again.

And other fun and exciting things happened I'm sure.

Being a ta for the computer science department kicks some fairly major ass.  I'm sitting in the lab, having my office hours, not doing a damn thing and getting paid.  I'll take it.

So I got my lip pierced again on wednesday, and they gave me the spiel about how to soak it and yadda yadda yadda and gave me the little sheet on how to care for it.  Apparently they need to make an addendum to that sheet that says 'do not drink a bunch of forties and smoke a bunch the day after you get a piercing' because when I woke up this morning my lip was so swollen that it was puffed out beyond the ring.  However, aside from looking like Don Freeman's sausage fingers exploding out of his wedding ring, it does look pretty sexy.

Also new with me: I'm going to Sweden to study abroad for a year starting this July, so get your Justin lovin' in now before it's gone.

Quite a blast from the past: So cute: Just one guy sucking another guy's udders, what? Maniacal Eric: Red hot lovers in love: Pure Sex: So, in conclusion, I should perm my hair and grow out my chops again. Can I get an "Amen"?

ATTENTION: If you are ovulating move away from the computer, because this entry is so potent that just reading it will get you pregnant. So we had a dodgeball tournament today at the IMA and we ended up in fourth. However we came in first in making a 'douche straight oppo' frat guy cry. We were in the middle of a game and it got to the point where they only had a couple of guys left and they would just stand in the back of the gym and not do anything. So everybody was just standing around and I was bored so I ran over to the side where there were a bunch of badminton birdies or shuttlecocks, if you prefer, lying around. As a joke I picked one up and tried to throw it across the gym and hit one of their guys but it just ended up floating like ten feet and landed off to the side. And then this kid who was sitting on the bench flipped out. He yelled "TIME OUT!" and then ran out onto the floor to remove it. Then Scott started taunting him by sarcastically yelling about how this is a serious dodgeball game and we cannot have amateur bullcrap like that; which drew the 'I would say something back if I wasn't a douchbag frat guy' stare-down. After we finished kicking their asses we were shaking hands and he gets right up in my face, musters the most laughable scowl and goes, "If you ever throw something on the court that's not a dodgeball again I'm going to have someone throw you out of the tournament." So then, after putting my foot up his ass, I followed him back to his bench and asked him why he had a seashell in his vagina. He says "(some frat that you could not give a shit about) put on this tournament so people could have fun, not so jackasses could throw stuff on the floor." I told him he was being an asshole and all I was doing was having fun, nobody else even cared and it didn't effect the game at all. To which he quipped: "How did it not effect the game?!" ... touche. So since he was such a proficient debater I had no choice but to walk away defeated. However, when I turned around he was crouched on the end of the bench with his face buried in his hands, and then he started doing the tough guy hold-back cry where you stifle your sobs and rub your eyes a bunch. I didn't think it was possible for someone to care so much about a fucking DODGEBALL game that they would cry over it. However, I was pleased to realize that I was wrong. Also, on the way to the IMA Scott found this VHS tape in the bushes by the path that had this flyer rubber-banded to it with some really cryptic message about "what happened to jake" or something like that and a URL for the website www.she-is-here.com. It turns out its some film-school ripoff of the tape from The Ring / maybe an alternative promotional technique for The Ring Two. Either way, it sucks that we're all going to die now.

Do you know what nemesis means?  "A righteous infliction of retribution manifested by an appropriate agent."  Personified, in this case, by a horrible cunt: me.

Learning an entire quarter of astronomy in one night is awesome.  Time to go purge my head and fill it with physics.

Shomer fucking Shabbos!

We need to let the people know that these new saucy spareribs taste like me, you, Michael Jordan, and Jennifer Lopez pulling a four-way on the 17th hole of Pebble Beach.

Uh, Cars. Barbecues. Sports. Tools.  Fixing stuff. Engines. Testosterone. Not asking for directions. Getting in fights.  Lifting weights. Peeing standing up. Football. Ladies. Big jugs. Arm wrestling. Guns. Hunting. Golfing. Smoking Cigars. Drinking Beers. Rodeos. Big Trucks. Fast. Explosions. 

Sweet Potato Pie!

Sara, Scott and I went to see Minus the Bear last night. The show was so good that, had I been a female with testicular remnants attached to my ovaries (your mom probably has 'em), the almost-non-stop rocking would have most definitely activated the testosterone in my remnants, thus resulting in the manifestation of several subtle male features. Though I spent much of the day taunting the opening band - a local group called Mon Frere - they definitely made me eat my words because they were really good. Then The Fall of Troy played, and even though I usually dislike hardcore as a general rule, they were also incredible. Their guitarist kicks major ass aside from also having a sweet mop. Mop as in hair. But the next band - a couple of louts who called themselves Idiot Pilot - sucked so much that I had to restrain myself from giving them a bone-crunching roundhouse kick in their collective chops. They had one computer, one guitar, two microphones, and about negative four talent between them, it was definitely un-American. The "vocalist" looked like a botched test-tube amalgam of Macaulay Culkin and Dorian Baum, and every time he took a break from talking about his super-cool nike swoosh wristbands to "sing" he would totally molest and fellate the microphone and stare out into the crowd with an open-mouthed, unbearably hyper-seductive face that made me want to douse the stage with the 800 molotov cocktails I now carry with me at all times. I wish I could have emptied an entire can of stream-sprayed powerful protection into his eyes. I also appreciated when they took a brief hiatus from their baby-killing "music" to call someone in the audience a faggot. It was good times. Also, the other day when several of us were getting money from an atm, we were suddenly accosted by the most pitiful and sadly pathetic transient in the history of transientry (which is now a word). He was a decrepit, white-haired, high-voiced old man, who looked very much like this character: and sounded very much like this character: and made me feel so bad that he could have told me to rip out and eat my own heart and I would have done it. However, in the end we all ran away without giving him so much as a single frito. We're definitely going to hell. Sorry old fella. I also finally put a new deadbolt on my door today so I can have a key to my room. Apparently our bulldog of a landlord thought it wasn't her responsibility to provide me with a key to the lock on my door, so after giving her a swift dragon-punch in the throat I went out and bought my own. Sorry whoever stole the key to our front door, no more free access to my bachelor pad.

I am a machine which produces pure sex. I can tell some of you out there might be thinking, "okay Justin you're full of bologna sausage". I'd understand your skepticism if it weren't for a little thing I like to call Vaguely reminiscent of another sex god, Anyway, I've put off writing in here for so long because every time I sit down I feel like I have to write a really long entry explaining everything that's happened since my last update. However, I've come up with an ingenious way to circumvent that predicament: I'm just not going to. Nope, sorry. Calculus midterms are awesome. Newest favorite quote: "You should shit your pants so you smell bad." -Eden Addis

So, in hindsight I have no idea why I didn't record this story in the annals of my lj long ago. Most of you have already heard it, but it is so awesome I need to write it down for posterity: About a month ago while I was still working at Panasonic, building tvs, one night I found myself at the back of the conveyor belt, loading cabinets on with two of my distinguished colleagues. And by distinguished colleagues I mean the pieces of infectious human waste I had to work with. Anyway, one of the guys starts to go on one of the most ridiculous and blatantly untrue rants I had ever heard about how many fights he gets in and how much of a tough guy he is, and various other lies. I'll try to reproduce as much as I can remember: "Man, I'll fight anybody. I don't care who it is. If you insult me or my family or try to start a fight with me, I just don't even give a shit, I'll fight you ... "I've never lost a fight before. The only fight I ever lost was when this guy flipped me over his back and broke my neck. And he's lucky he broke my neck or else I would have killed him ... "This one time I was walking by this room and I saw all these bodybuilders shooting up 'roids and so I started laughing at them. Then as I was walking away one of them ran up behind me and jammed his thumb into my eye and then started punching me. But it just felt like my little sister was punching me so I just laughed and then put him on the ground ... "One time I was at this hotel and I looked out my window and I saw some guys out in the parking lot and they were looking really suspicious. So I went down where they were and I looked in this dumpster and I found one of those 55 gallon garbage bags completely full of weed so I threw it in the back of my van and sold it for 1400 bucks ..." Then, sadly, he got moved to another part of the belt. I remember thinking as he was walking away, "Man, that is definately the most bullshit I will hear today." However, the guy that took his place pleasantly surprised me with his tales of even more jaw-dropping, mind-blowing bullshit: "I've had 5 friends that died within the last year; 4 committed suicide and one of them committed suicide by cop because he had a meth lab and then they raided it so he ran at a cop with a butcher knife ... "We were sitting in the parking lot of some fast food place and one of my friends was in the backseat and then we hear a gunshot and he had shot himself in the head with a shotgun. Man, it was a nice car too ..." but this story got the gold medal in the bullshit olympics: "Me and my friends have this pact that after you die, four years later everyone has to dig up your body, grind up your bones and snort them. So I've snorted 3 of my friends so far. We still have one of my friends' skull in the back of my friend's car. We like to drive around with it." So, in conclusion, you all better dig up my body, grind up my bones and snort them after I'm dead.

Listen up you undapants:

I just spent the last 20 minutes trying to get into my own house.  It sucked arse.  Since Sara drove me home I didn't have any keys, and the spare key at the front of the house was missing.  After skulking around the house checking all the doors and windows I just sat on my deck for about 10 minutes, staring at the chimney and wondering if I could squeeze my full figure down it.  Then I remembered we also have a spare key in the back of my house too.  But since it was practically pitch black, it took about another 10 minutes to find it and then operate the locks.  God, I would be such an awesome cat burglar.  Chewbacca just ate a rubber band.  I thought she was just playing with it but then I looked over and there were only a few small shreds left.  I hope she doesn't kick the bucket or run down the curtain and join the choir invisible.

So I have to say I was thoroughly dissappointed with today's season premier of Smallville.  This episode had the worst possible beginning (opening with a video of the abominable Chloe Sullivan) and an even more heart-breaking and detestable ending (I won't spoil it for those few losers out there who haven't seen it yet - needless to say it will most definately give me nightmares).  The only real plot development was that we met Lois Lane, however, she is a terrible actress and her character is far too similar to that of Chloe.  The only thing that made this episode especially noteworthy was that we got so see Clark and Lana in the buff multiple times (not together, of course) and we even got to see the top half of Tom Welling's arse.  When I saw that I totally got the vapors.

But after Smallville was over we got to meet the cutest little kid named Zion.  He's 5 years old, weighs 160 lbs., and doesn't seem to own a shirt.

Now it is my intention to go play video games for several hours.

Newest favorite quote:
"What I lacked in running endurance, I made up for with a massive erection."
-Nick "the Greek" Astete

p.s. who wants to get hogtied. pushed down. into. some snakewater?

So Sara and I were on our way to Rocky Butte last night, and while we were stopped at a light on Sandy we saw a workin' gal get cuffed and picked up by a couple of 5-Oh. In the process she dropped something that looked suspiciously like drugs, but the pigs must not have noticed. And Sara wouldn't jump out of the car, run across the street and pick them up; what a lousy friend. I mean, we could have been shooting up classy hooker drugs, but instead I just stepped in some dog doo. That sucked. Oh yeah, and Nick Astete is a god. He has the strength of ten men, the speed of a cheetah, and the sexual potency of 2 Neil Diamonds, 6 David Hasselhoffs, and 20 Wilt Chamberlains combined. And he's a good dancer. But he'd be even cooler if he had a tattoo like
If anyone is ever sitting around thinking to themself: "what is the worst possible way I could spend the next few hours of my life?" then I recommend you go to a rodeo.

Dear Almighty One, I come to you now in my moment of need.  I call upon all the powers of your dark forces to deliver me into the fiery pits of Hell where I was born; my father a demon; my mother a jackal.  Sweet, sweet, Satan; now is the time for your reign of death and terror to begin.

I hate people who have no conceptual grasp of grammar.  For example, there's the cliched grammar mistake which everyone complains about:

your vs. you're

which I see all the time, but most appreciate when I'm being ridiculed.  For example:

Your an idiot. 

The irony tickles my ribs.  But my numero uno pet peeve, which never ceases to get me fiery hot with anger, is when people write:

could of = could've

such as:

Man, I could of won that hand if I'd stayed in.

Every time I see that I throw up in my mouth a little bit and then punch my computer screen.  Take some english classes people.

Anyway, now that I've gotten that off my chest ... Today was an uncharacteristically uneventful day (uncharacteristically = conventionally).  I went to Powells City of Books and it rocked me inside and out, as it always does, spent too much money on books, then went school clothes shopping at V squared.  But it could be worse.  I could live in Florida and have my house destroyed by 3 consecutive hurricanes. HAHAHAHAHAHA.  Oh man, that's not funny.

Tentative list of major lifetime regrets:

1. Cutting my hair

2. Not getting dreads before I cut my hair

3. Taking out my lip ring

4. Ever playing the devil's game (also known as blackjack)

5. Allowing my parents to discover certain ... paraphernalia

6. Ever giving Allison Lee rides home after baseball practice

7. Dating one person for over 4 years

8. Taking rolls and rolls of pictures of random cars in Washington D.C.

9. Being born with a hole in my heart (although it did earn me a cool 50 bucks)

10. Not calling Al Aldridge a colostomy bag to his face

11. Discontinuing my piano lessons

12. Not kicking as much ass as I could have

I'm tired

to be continued

My stomach hurts.

And my sweat smells like coconut cream.

Hmmm, I was wondering what that smell was.  Turns out I had forgotten that I didn't finish my mug of hot chocolate, so it's been festering and putrefying for a couple of days in a remote corner of my cluttered desk.  So I drank it.  Delicious.
"Man, fuck that shit." - Phil, who is still bitching about that weird blue light. I think he should relax, like so:
So the sky mysteriously flashed entirely blue just a minute ago.  Phil is flipping out and I think he's going to cry.  Weird.

I went to bed at 6 o'clock this morning. That ruled, especially since it was completely light out by 4:30. After a morning and early afternoon of utter unproductivity, I went with Colin and Phil to climb the rock wall. So I tried all day yesterday, and all day today to climb this specific route up one face of the wall, which is pretty tough, and all I got for my hard work was huge chunks taken out of three of my fingers and a swift kick in the bollocks. I didn't think too much of not being able to climb it since I'm just starting out, that was until this little 6-year old bastard showed up and totally put me in my place. On his first try he got as far as I had ever gotten, and by his fifth or sixth try he was up and over the wall. I could not have felt any more inadequate. So to make myself feel better I coaxed him behind some dumpsters with some candy and broke his face. Ok, maybe not. I was too impressed. But at least I'm bigger than him, and probably have hair in places where he doesn't. Go me. Later I decided somewhat randomly that if I were an adult film star, my porn name would have to be "Tony the Tuna-can Tantalizer", but you can call me "Tony T's" for short. Alright, that's all I gots. P.S. Vinnie Jones is my hero.

I was watching some episodes of Monty Python's Flying Circus today, and I realized that I had forgotten how ridiculously awesome and hilarious it is. If someone asked me what the funniest thing in the world was, I would have to say Monty Python's Flying Circus. I hereby issue my first decree: you all must watch it. If anyone is actually interested I have all the episodes and most of their movies on my computer. Anyway, that's all I wanted to say. See, this guy's funny 'cause he's fat and stuff. Oh man that's funny. This should be you watching Monty Python. P.S. John Cleese is, quite possibly, the sexiest man alive.

So I was walking to the gym today to go work out, thinking about how much I hate all spiders and most insects and how I wouldn't mind if they ceased existing, when this crow dive-bombed straight into the side of my head. So now they're gone too. Here is an updated list of animals that need to become extinct: crows, spiders, most insects (particularly leafcutter ants which, as far as I'm concerned pose an immediate threat of overtaking homosapiens as the dominant species on the planet), possums, vultures, nutrias, christians, the tsetse fly, old people, the AIDS virus, rats (especially the ones that live on ships and grow to 2 feet), bigfoot, stupid slow turtles that only move 2 mph but live for 200 years, crabs (because they look so much like spiders), slugs and snails, and candiru fish (the fish in the amazon that swims up your urethra, spreads its fins and eats away the mucous membranes until it dies, you die, or you get a penectomy - fuck that fish). And here is a list of animals that there need to be more of: ferrets, ducks, monkeys, panthers, those lizards that run on water, meerkats, giraffes, otters, raccoons, komodo dragons, and koalas. Feel free to recommend additions to either of these lists. This Giant Wood Spider from Okinawa, Japan grows to 7 inches. That's bullshit. It thrives by being, by far, the creepiest animal on the planet Seen here, a particularly invasive and dangerous sub-group of the species Christians: Missionaries, infiltrating a non-native habitat. This species thrives by assimilating and then dominating local species and ecosystems

Seriously, could it be raining any harder? As I'm leaving the Astronomy/Physics building, the road I have to cross to get back to my room has mysteriously been replaced by a raging river. RAGING. By the time I got back to my room I was all kinds of moist. And what's more, it's all my fault. When I went back to Vancouver this last weekend it was really overcast and drizzly, and I kept commenting on how much the weather sucks there and how nice it's been in Seattle, and how we have hardly any rain, blah blah blah. I totally jinxed it. For those of you who are not familiar with my tried and true theory, which can be mathematically represented as: Me = bad weather and sometimes even extended to: Me = natural disasters I refer you to the results of some of my previous 'experiments'. #1) The first time I ever went to Arizona was to play a baseball tournament at the White Sox spring training facility in Tucson. The first day of the tournament, a storm rolls in so fast, that by the time we make it out to the parking lot, the rain is pouring in sideways, and the wind is blowing so hard that when we open the back door of the van, the wind catches it, and wraps it completely around the side of the van. By the time we got back to our hotel we weren't allowed to leave because there were flash-floods everywhere, and lightning even struck our hotel parking lot. It then proceeded to rain harder than I have ever seen it rain in my life. The trip was later redeemed by me finding a huge frog in the pool, but that's a different story for a different time. #2) The first time I went to Black Butte resort in central Oregon with Colin's family, it again rained harder than I had ever seen it rain in my life, knocking my Arizona trip off it's #1 pedestal. Just going the ten feet from the car to the front door of our cabin made it look like we had just gotten out of the pool. #3) The second time I went to Black Butte, there were forest fires all over central Oregon. However, if you looked at a map of the surrounding area, you could see a large section of forest that was or had been on fire, then a long straight perimeter which had been set up, and the Black Butte ranch a comfortable distance away from this fire line. Yet, overnight, a small arm proceeded to jump the fireproof perimeter, and then make a b-line straight for the ranch. We were forced to evacuate the next day. #4) The first time I ever went to Florida, again it rained harder than I had ever seen it rain in my life. We were at Sea World at the time and I remember us sitting in a large arena waiting for a show when lightning struck the LED board about 300 meters away. They had to cancel the show. #5) The first time I ever went to Las Vegas was last year for a Model UN conference. Much to my surprise it didn't rain harder than I had ever seen it rain in my life, but then again it wasn't typical Las Vegas weather. It rained about half the time, and the other time it was completely overcast with heavy winds. So, in conclusion, I think I have done a great job illustrating the many differing opinions about hustle and bustle, may they both rest in peace. P.S. Update: Just to give you an idea of how hard it was raining today, I was just on my way back from dinner and I saw 3 ducks swimming, that's right I said swimming, across the lawn.

I am watching fox's new reality show/atrocity: The Swan.  'Why' you ask?  eh, i don't know.  Probably the same reason you can never look away from a trainwreck.  The premise is that they take 'homely' women with low self-esteem and give them radical cosmetic surgery, then parade them in swimsuits and lingerie in a pageant.  Ridiculous.  But I can't look away.  But what's sad is this is just one part of the ever-increasing ridiculousness of new reality tv.  I'm still waiting for Phil's premise for a reality show where people are marooned on an island and forced to take LSD 24-7 while we observe the ensuing hilarity and, most likely, eventual homicide.

On a side note, I went home this weekend and saw my family and friends, blah blah blah.  I say blah blah blah because, while it was fun, it was completely overshadowed by a random encounter when I was waiting for the bus to get back to school.  So this fella comes up to me as I'm at the bus stop and asks Tim if he can sing.  He says, "no, but he can sing" pointing to me.  So the guy turns to me and says, "sing something."  And I keep telling him no, and that I can't really sing and everything so he'll leave me alone.  Then he turns to me, looks me dead in the eyes with a completely straight face and says, "sing something or I'll kill you."  So I start laughing and Tim starts laughing and the guy kind of scoffs and then looks straight at me again, stares into my soul, and then says, "no, I'm serious."  That's when I freeze and kind of look around, and then the guy starts laughing.  What a good joke.  I've got to remember that one.  Oh, and not for nothing, the guy was black.  So ... you know.

By the way, I'm not racist.
